alert.note: Alert for Erie (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 12:35PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding of roadways and low lying areas. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Erie and Huron. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some roadways remains closed due to the heavy rainfall overnight and this morning, but water is slowly receeding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 PM EDT, Emergency management reported flooding of roadways in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandusky, Norwalk, Western Vermilion, New London, Milan, Northern Milan, Wakeman, Monroeville, Berlin Heights, Birmingham, Fairview Lanes, Bloomingville and Sandusky South.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
